page.title: 02Horsesteads Farm - Shawforth
page.content: Owner - Mrs. Earnshaw (Senior) Worked by Mr. & Mrs. W. Earnshaw and sons. The farm is built of local stone and is about 100 years old. It is an established family farming business run as a dairy and sheep farm covering 50 acres. The Earnshaws have a herd of 24 cows, 300 sheep, 4 working dogs, 3 guard dogs and 1 pup, plus 40 free range hens. The farming year starts in April at lambing time. The sheep are clipped in June and dipped in August and October. Hay making is a busy time and takes place between July and August. Mr. Earnshaw gets up to milk the cows and clean the shippons at 6.00 a.m. He milks again at night and goes to bed at 9.00 p.m.
